title: Allerton Bywater Walks

images.title: David Pickersgill / Three ways to go
images.caption: Three ways to go. Footpath sign on the bank of the River Aire, Allerton Bywater.

images.title: Paul Johnston-Knight / Allerton Bywater
images.caption: These lakes, ponds, ings, have formed over the former pit under the village, depressed since the closure of the mines, but now undergoing resurgence with the advent of Millennium Village ("the place that's going to be the place to be") - built by English Partnerships and comprising new affordable housing, commercial and industrial premises.

images.title: Lake near the River Aire by JThomas, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lake near the River Aire

images.title: David Pickersgill / Allerton Ings
images.caption: Allerton Ings. One of many lakes in this area created by mining subsidence. A line of Canada Geese heads out on to the water.

images.title: Richard Avery, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: St Aidan's Nature Reserve

images.title: Allerton Bywater Church by JThomas, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Allerton Bywater Church

images.title: David Pickersgill / Two Boats
images.caption: Two Boats The Boat Inn, Allerton Bywater, reflected in the water of the River Calder, with a newly-built narrowboat tied up further along the bank.

images.title: Betty Longbottom / Allerton Bywater War Memorial - Main Street
images.caption: War Memorial on the Main Street in the village.

description: This village near Leeds has a series of pleasant waterside footpaths to try. It's a nice place for an easy walk with plenty of wildfowl to see and a fine riverside pub for post walk refreshment. This walk from the village visits the Allerton Ings and St Aidan's nature reserve. In the village you'll find a number of small lakes or 'Ings' with pleasant waterside footpaths. The River Aire also runs through the area so there's plenty of water loving wildlife to look out for on the way. Keep your eyes peeled for species such as bittern, marsh harrier and skylark on the walk.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Boat is a traditional pub located next to the River Aire. There's a good menu and nice garden to sit out in on warmer days. You can find them at postcode WF10 2BX. The pub is dog friendly if you have your canine friend with you.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head south east and you could visit Fairburn Ings Nature Reserve near Castleford. There's more lakes and riverside paths to enjoy here.

display_address: Boat Lane, Allerton Bywater, West Yorkshire, England, WF10 2PG, United Kingdom
